contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=September 2007}} {{Infobox Prime Minister | name = Dragiša Cvetković | image = Dragiša Cvetković.jpg | office = | term_start = | term_end = | monarch = | predecessor = | successor = | office2 = | term_start2 = | term_end2 = | predecessor2 = | successor2 = | birth_date = | birth_place = | nationality = | religion = | death_date = | death_place = | party = |}} '''Dragiša Cvetković''' ([[Serbian Cyrillic]]: Драгиша Цветковић) (15 January 1893, [[Niš]] – February 18, 1969, [[Paris]]) was a [[Yugoslavia|Yugoslav]] [[politician]]. He served as the [[prime minister]] of the [[Kingdom of Yugoslavia]] from 1939 to 1941. He developed the federalization of Yugoslavia through the creation of the [[Banovina of Croatia]] by an agreement with [[Croatia]]n leader [[Vladko Maček]]. See [[Cvetković-Maček Agreement]] He left [[Serbia (1941–1944)|Serbia]] on September 4, 1944 for [[Bulgaria]], and later to [[Turkey]]. He spent the rest of his life in Paris. On September 25, 2009, the regional court in Cvetković's hometown of [[Niš]] rehabilitated him from charges laid against him by the Yugoslav government in 1945.<ref>[http://www.politika.rs/rubrike/vesti-dana/Rehabilitovan-Dragisha-Cvetkovic.lt.html Rehabilitovan Dragiša Cvetković], [[Politika]]</ref> == References == {{Reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box | before=[[Milan Stojadinović]] | title=[[Prime Minister of Yugoslavia]] | years=1939–1941 | after= [[Dušan Simović]]}} {{s-end}} {{Yugoslavia Prime Ministers}} {{Cabinet Dragiša Cvetković II}} {{Authority control|VIAF=62356761}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Cvetkovic, Dragisa | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 15 January 1893 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = February 18, 1969 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cvetkovic, Dragisa}} [[Category:1893 births]] [[Category:1969 deaths]] [[Category:People from Niš]] [[Category:Yugoslav Radical Union politicians]] [[Category:Serbian politicians]] [[Category:Prime Ministers of Yugoslavia]] {{Yugoslavia-bio-stub}}
